MainHeading.P: Do chuaidh an Cathaoirleach i gceannas ar 12 meadhon lae.

MainHeading.Title: PRIVATE BUSINESS. - PILOTAGE ORDER CONFIRMATION (No. 2) BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Motion made—That this Bill be received for final consideration and do now pass.—(Senator Bennett.)

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - LOCAL ELECTIONS BILL, 1927—REPORT STAGE.

Speaker.P: There were no amendments in Committee to this Bill, and no amendments have been tabled for the Report Stage.
Motion made—That the Bill be received on Report.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - DEFENCE FORCES (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) (No. 2) BILL, 1927—REPORT STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Motion made—That the Bill be received on Report.

Speaker.P: This Bill has been certified by the Ceann Comhairle of the Dáil as a Money Bill.
Motion made—That the Bill be received on Report.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - SUSPENSION OF STANDING ORDERS.

Speaker.hpid: Sir HENRY BELLINGHAM Sir HENRY BELLINGHAM
Speaker.P: On behalf of Senator Guinness, I move:—“That the Standing Orders be suspended for the purpose of enabling the Fifth Stage of the following Bills to be taken to-day, Friday, 2nd December, 1927:—Local Elections Bill, 1927, Defence Forces (Temporary Provisions) (No. 2) Bill, 1927, and the Finance (No. 2) Bill, 1927.”

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - LOCAL ELECTIONS BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Motion made—That the Bill be received for final consideration and do now pass.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - DEFENCE FORCES (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) (No. 2) BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Motion made—That the Bill be received for final consideration and do now pass.

MainHeading.Title: PUBLIC BUSINESS. - FINANCE (No. 2) BILL, 1927—FIFTH STAGE.
MainHeading.P: Motion made—That the Bill be received for final consideration and do now pass.

Speaker.P: As matters at present stand it will not be necessary for the Seanad to meet again before the 15th February next. In the event of any contingency arising which would render a meeting of the House necessary, a meeting will be duly convened on proper notice.
